Deep.visual_prompt: south asian man early 30s, tall angular face, wire frame glasses, architect coat over gray uniform, notebook in hand, thoughtful intense gaze

anaya.visual_prompt: south asian woman late 20s, sharp features, dark intense eyes, close-cropped black hair, lean muscular build, gray worker coveralls, red thread on collar, determined expression

lin.visual_prompt: east asian androgynous person mid 20s, soft delicate features, pale blue data-operator uniform, subtle implant glow behind ear

film.logline: In a subterranean future where every human is implanted and owned, Anaya's implant glitches — and she begins to see.
film.style_prompt_prefix: cinematic anime, detailed character art, dramatic lighting, film grain, anamorphic lens, dark dystopian underground city, muted blue-green palette, production quality animation
film.title: The Mole World — Chapter 1

parts.description: Chapter 1 — Underground world revealed, the system exposed, Anaya's awakening, Lin's discovery, Deep's rebellion, first contact

scenes.location: Underground city — vast cavern with bioluminescent walls

shots.action: Vast underground cavern stretching into darkness. Bioluminescent moss glows pale blue-green on massive cavern walls. Thousands of identical dormitory pods stacked like honeycomb cells reaching upward. Tiny silhouette figures move in synchronized patterns far below.
shots.camera: extreme wide shot, slow dolly forward

shots.action: Bioluminescent moss clusters pulse gently on raw stone. Close enough to see the texture of the rock, the organic glow shifting in slow waves. Water beads condense on the surface. The beauty is alien and ancient, predating the city carved within it.
shots.camera: slow tracking shot along cavern wall

shots.action: Camera descends through layers of the underground city. Metal walkways connect towers of living pods. Blue-white strip lighting illuminates corridors. Workers in gray coveralls walk in orderly lines. Everything perfectly organized, perfectly controlled.

A massive ventilation shaft stretches upward like a cathedral nave. Industrial fans turn slowly in the darkness above. Warm air rises from the tunnels below carrying dust and the smell of stone. The mechanical breathing of the underground city.
shots.camera: wide shot, slow pan left to right

shots.action: Looking upward from the cavern floor. The ceiling impossibly far above, covered in bioluminescent moss that mimics a starfield. Metal structures and walkways criss-cross like a vast mechanical web. A single bright light pulses at the center like a synthetic sun.
shots.camera: low angle wide shot, looking up

shots.action: A row of dormitory pods at eye level. Each pod has a small window glowing faint blue. Through one window, a silhouette sits perfectly still. Through the next, another. Through the next, another. Hundreds of identical lives contained in identical boxes.
shots.camera: medium shot, static with slight drift

shots.action: A row of workers walking along a metal walkway. Their faces blank, eyes forward. Identical gray coveralls. Behind each ear, a small implant glows steady blue. The walkway stretches into perspective. Strip lighting pulses in rhythm like a heartbeat.

The entire cavern city from the highest vantage point. The synthetic sun dims slowly from white to amber to deep blue. Artificial twilight descending. The bioluminescent moss brightens in response, the underground sky coming alive as the day cycle ends. A world that has forgotten what real sunlight means.

scenes.location: Underground transit system — tube corridors and checkpoints

shots.action: Workers move through a wide transit tunnel on moving walkways. Holographic signs flash district numbers and work assignments. The tunnel walls are smooth metal, lit by strip LEDs that change color at each zone boundary. Everyone faces forward, nobody talks.
shots.camera: wide shot, tracking alongside moving workers

shots.action: A security checkpoint. Workers pass through a scanner arch one by one. Each implant registers with a green pulse. A holographic display shows worker ID, district assignment, and ownership status. Brief flash of corporate logos. The scanner hums.

Close-up of an implant behind a worker's ear as they pass through the scanner. The device pulses green, then returns to steady blue. Data streams briefly visible as holographic text near the implant. The skin around it is slightly scarred, the implant embedded since childhood.

Two guards in black uniforms stand on an elevated platform above the transit flow. Their implants glow a different color, gold instead of blue. They watch the workers with blank professional detachment. Behind them, screens show real-time worker feeds.
shots.camera: low angle, looking up at guard platform

shots.action: Point of view moving through the transit crowd. Workers on all sides, faces blank, eyes forward. The corridor seems endless. Occasional holographic advertisements for corporate loyalty programs. The sound of footsteps is perfectly synchronized.

Overhead view of workers splitting into different tunnel branches at an intersection. Seen from above they form geometric patterns, rivers of gray splitting and merging with mathematical precision. The efficiency of a colony, the aesthetics of a machine.

scenes.location: Anaya's dormitory pod — tiny capsule room

shots.action: Anaya's face in the dim blue light of her pod. Eyes closed. A tone sounds. Her eyes open — sharp, alert, already thinking. The implant behind her ear glows steady blue. She touches it absently, a habitual gesture.

Anaya at a communal washing basin in a narrow corridor. She splashes water on her face. In the metal surface of the basin she catches her reflection, distorted. She stares at it a beat too long, as if seeing someone she does not quite recognize.

Anaya sits up in her narrow pod. Gray walls, thin mattress, small shelf with nothing personal. She pulls on her coveralls methodically. The red thread sewn into her collar catches the light — her one secret rebellion.

Anaya walks through the transit corridor toward her work assignment. Strip lighting plays across her face in rhythmic patterns. She watches other workers as she walks, studying their faces, the way they move. No one else is watching anything except the path ahead.

Anaya slides open her pod door. A long corridor of identical pods stretches in both directions. Other workers emerge simultaneously, moving in the same direction. No one speaks. No one makes eye contact.

Anaya's hand at her side as she walks. Her fingers flex, curl, release. A subtle gesture of contained energy. The red thread on her collar just visible at the edge of frame. Her hand brushes the wall as she passes, feeling the stone beneath the metal.

scenes.location: Communal food hall — sterile white space with long tables

shots.action: Vast communal dining hall. Long white tables stretch to the far wall. Workers sit in rows, eating in silence. The food is gray nutrient paste served in identical containers. Overhead lights are harsh and white. A holographic display shows the meal schedule and nutrition metrics.

A portion of nutrient paste in a metal container. Gray, uniform, functional. A spoon moves through it mechanically. Pull focus to the hand holding the spoon — Anaya's hand, calloused and strong. She eats without looking at the food.

Anaya glances across the food hall. Hundreds of faces, all blank, all chewing in the same rhythm. Their implants pulse together in a gentle synchronized wave. It is beautiful and terrifying. A coordination they cannot see or choose.

A worker at a nearby table drops their food container. It clangs on the metal floor. Everyone freezes. Two guards at the hall perimeter turn their heads. The worker picks it up with trembling hands. The moment passes. Everyone resumes eating. The silence heavier now.
Anaya watches the incident. Her eyes track the guards as they return to their posts. She notes their positions, their patterns. She is mapping the system, even if she does not yet know why.

scenes.location: Deep tunnels — raw rock, construction zone
scenes.mood: grinding labor, oppressive heat and noise

shots.action: Workers in gray coveralls dig and haul in a massive tunnel under construction. Sparks fly from cutting tools. The air thick with dust caught in harsh industrial lighting. Anaya works among them, muscles taut, swinging a heavy tool into rock.

The tunnel stretches deep into the rock. Workers are spread along its length like ants in a colony. Harsh industrial lights create pools of illumination separated by darkness. Rock dust hangs in the air like fog. The scale of the excavation is immense and purposeless.
shots.camera: wide shot, static with dust particles

shots.action: A foreman on an elevated platform watches the workers. His implant glows gold. He checks a holographic clipboard showing productivity metrics for each worker. Anaya's name appears, her efficiency rating high. He moves on without interest.

Anaya's hands gripping a rock-cutting tool. Knuckles white, calloused. Sweat on her forearms. She pauses. Something in the rock catches her eye — a fossil, or a pattern. Something from before. She stares.

The pattern in the rock face in detail. It looks like a leaf imprint, millions of years old. Fossilized evidence of a world that existed above. Sunlight captured in stone. Anaya's fingertips approach it, touching something that once knew the sky.

Anaya reaches out to touch the pattern in the rock. Her implant suddenly flickers — blue to red to blue. She flinches. Other workers do not notice. She looks around quickly, then hides the pattern by shifting rubble over it. Her breathing faster now.

From above, Anaya is one of dozens of workers but she has stopped moving. A still figure in a sea of motion. Other workers flow around her like water around a stone. No one pauses. No one asks. She resumes work, but her rhythm has changed.

The implant behind Anaya's ear pulses erratically. Under the skin the circuitry flickers between blue and red like a dying signal. Tiny veins visible around the implant. A drop of sweat runs past it. The glow stabilizes back to blue but dimmer now.

The shift bell rings. Workers put down tools in unison and file toward the tunnel exit in ordered lines. Anaya is the last to move. She places her hand flat against the wall where the fossil was, feeling the stone's warmth. Then she follows the others out.

scenes.location: Surveillance operations center — dark room with screens

shots.action: A circular room filled with surveillance screens. Hundreds of feeds showing workers in tunnels, corridors, pods. Operators sit at stations, their gold implants glowing. The room hums with data. At the center, a massive holographic sphere shows the entire underground city in miniature.
shots.camera: wide shot, slow orbit around room

shots.action: Surveillance screens cycling through feeds. Workers eating. Workers sleeping. Workers digging. The same faces in the same routines. On one screen, briefly, Anaya's face. Her implant data reads slightly anomalous. The operator does not notice, scrolls past.

An operator reviews the daily anomaly report. A list of minor implant fluctuations. Worker 7749 appears briefly. The operator marks it as environmental interference, common in the deep tunnels. A routine dismissal of what is not routine at all.
shots.camera: over-shoulder of operator, looking at display

shots.action: Pull back from the surveillance center through a corridor to reveal it is just one node in a vast network. Other rooms, other operators, other screens. The system watching the workers watching themselves. Control as architecture, invisible and total.
shots.camera: extreme wide shot pulling back through the room

scenes.location: Data stream center — dark room with floating holographic displays

shots.action: A circular room filled with floating holographic displays showing streams of data — ownership records, worker metrics, transfer logs. Operators sit at stations, faces lit by blue data light. Lin sits among them, fingers moving across a display, eyes tracking patterns others cannot see.

Lin's slender fingers dance across holographic data streams. Their movements are precise, practiced. But occasionally a finger pauses, hovers over a data point that others scroll past. Names being reassigned. Histories being erased. Patterns in the deletions.
shots.camera: close-up on hands, shallow depth of field

shots.action: Lin at their station, surrounded by other operators. Everyone works identically. But Lin's eyes move differently, scanning not just the assigned data but the data around it. The gaps. The absences. What the system does not want them to see.

Lin's face reflects the data streams. Their implant glitches briefly and in the holographic display, for a split second, an image appears that does not belong: a forest, sunlight, open sky. Lin blinks. The image is gone. They look around. No one else saw it.
shots.camera: close-up on face, rack focus to display

shots.action: Lin's implant behind their ear. It flickers just as Anaya's did, blue to red to blue. Lin winces almost imperceptibly. Their hand moves to their ear, then stops. They cannot draw attention. They return to work, but their hands are trembling slightly.

Night cycle in the dormitory corridor. Dim red emergency lighting casts everything in shadow. Other workers sleep in their pods, implants glowing steady blue through the small windows. The corridor is silent except for the low hum of ventilation.
shots.camera: medium shot, dim red emergency lighting

shots.action: Anaya lies in her pod, eyes wide open. The red emergency light catches the sharp planes of her face. She stares at the ceiling less than an arm's length above. Her breathing is controlled but her eyes are restless, moving, thinking.

Flash of fragmented memory. Blinding sunlight through green leaves. The image is overexposed, golden, warm. It shatters into static. Then another flash: a child's hand reaching for a butterfly against blue sky. Static again. These are not her memories. Or are they.

Flash of rain falling on an upturned face. The feeling of open air. Grass beneath bare feet, impossibly green. Then a face, blurred, a woman smiling. The image tears apart like corrupted data. Back to the pod ceiling. Anaya gasps silently.

Anaya sits up in her pod. Sweat on her forehead. She presses her palm against the cool metal wall, grounding herself. She looks at her hands in the dim red light. Turns them over. These hands that break rock. What else could they do.

A guard patrol passes outside the pod corridor. A searchlight sweeps through the pod windows one by one. Anaya lies flat, eyes closed, pretending sleep. The light crosses her face. Pauses. Moves on. She exhales when it is gone.

Anaya's eye in extreme close-up, reflecting the faint bioluminescent glow from outside her pod window. The iris contracts and dilates. In the reflection, the tiny lights of the underground city. Slow zoom out to reveal her face, resolved and awake. She will not sleep tonight. Something has changed that cannot change back.
shots.camera: extreme close-up, then slow zoom out

shots.action: Hundreds of workers seated in perfect rows in a stark white amphitheater. A massive holographic display at the center shows ownership transfer data. Names and numbers scroll endlessly. A calm synthetic voice announces reassignments. Some workers stand when called and walk to exits marked with different colors.
shots.camera: high angle wide shot, slow zoom

shots.action: The synthetic voice calls a name. A woman in the third row stands mechanically. She does not look left or right. She walks to the blue exit. Another name. A man stands. The red exit. Their faces show nothing. The implants ensure compliance.

A young worker is called. He stands but hesitates. A flicker of something crosses his face. Fear. Resistance. His implant pulses rapidly. Two guards at the perimeter step forward. The moment passes. The implant steadies. He walks to his assigned exit. The guards step back.
shots.emotion: crushed resistance, what happens when you hesitate

shots.action: Anaya walks into the amphitheater with other workers. She finds a seat. Her eyes scan the crowd — not the display, the people. She is looking for something. Someone. The red thread on her collar is barely visible.

Across the amphitheater, a man is not watching the display. Deep sits sketching in a small notebook, head down, wire-frame glasses catching the light. His architect coat worn at the elbows. Anaya watches him — the only other person not obeying the screen.

Deep looks up from his notebook. His eyes find Anaya's across the hall. A beat. Neither looks away. In a world where no one sees each other, two people actually see. Then both look away simultaneously, aware of the danger.
shots.camera: close-up on Deep, then match cut to Anaya

shots.action: Deep resumes sketching but his hand moves differently now. Faster. He tears a corner from a page and writes something small. He holds the scrap between two fingers, casual, invisible to anyone not watching. Anaya is watching.

The holographic ownership display fills the frame from below. Numbers and names cascade like digital rain. Among the data, Anaya's designation appears — Worker 7749, District 12, Owner CORP-ZENITH. She is property. Her face reflected faintly in the holographic surface, watching her own designation scroll past.
shots.camera: low angle close-up, looking up at display

shots.action: The assembly ends. Workers stand and file out in orderly streams. In the flow of gray coveralls, Deep moves past Anaya's row. As he passes, his hand brushes the armrest where she sat. The scrap of paper is gone. It is in her hand now. Neither looks at the other. Perfect choreography of the forbidden.

Workers file out of the Selection Hall in orderly streams. Anaya walks among them but her pace is different — slightly faster, slightly more aware. She glances back toward where Deep was sitting. The corridor is long, lit by cold strip lights.

Anaya's hand in her pocket, fingers closed around the scrap of paper Deep passed her. She does not look at it. Not here. Not with cameras in the corridors and implants that monitor attention. She walks steadily, her face composed, her hand holding a secret.

Anaya stops in an alcove where the corridor branches. She leans against the wall. Her implant begins to pulse — blue, red, blue, red. Pain crosses her face. She presses her fingers against it. Flashes of images — sunlight, trees, open sky, a child laughing. Things she has never seen but somehow knows.
shots.camera: medium shot, then slow zoom to extreme close-up

shots.action: Anaya's vision distorts. The corridor walls ripple, the metal transforms briefly into tree bark. The strip lights become sunbeams. Workers passing become ghostly figures in a forest. The vision stutters, flickers between underground and surface world. Then snaps back to cold reality.

A worker passes the alcove and glances at Anaya. She straightens immediately, composing her face. The worker moves on without interest. Anaya waits until they are gone. She opens her hand and reads the scrap of paper. A single word and a number. A location.

The corridor is empty now. Anaya stands alone in the alcove, breathing hard. She looks at her hands as if seeing them for the first time. She touches the red thread on her collar. Then she straightens, lifts her chin, and walks forward with new purpose. The bioluminescent light shifts subtly warmer around her.
shots.camera: wide shot, Anaya small in frame
shots.emotion: resolve, transformation, hope born from pain

shots.action: Deep's architect station. A semi-private workspace on an elevated platform overlooking the construction zone. Holographic blueprints float above his desk. Official tunnel expansion plans. His notebook lies open beside them. He works with quiet precision.
shots.camera: wide shot, looking into the workspace

shots.action: Deep's hands sketching in his notebook. Ink-stained fingers, the lines precise and architectural. He draws the tunnel system, but his version includes things the official blueprints do not. Weak points. Old passages. A path that leads up.

Over Deep's shoulder, his notebook page visible. A detailed drawing of a door in a wall that does not have one. Annotations in tiny handwriting. Structural calculations. How thick the rock is. How deep they are. The first architecture of freedom.

Another architect passes Deep's station. Deep casually flips to an official blueprint page. They exchange a nod. The colleague moves on. Deep waits three breaths, then returns to his real work. His face is calm. He has been doing this for years.

End of shift. Deep closes his notebook and slides it into his architect coat. He looks out over the construction zone below. Workers filing out. He removes his glasses, cleans them slowly. Behind his ear, his implant flickers once. He touches it. Something has been flickering for a while now.
shots.camera: medium wide shot, slow push in

shots.action: Deep walks through the corridors after shift. He takes a route no one else takes, turning into a narrower passage, then another. Each turn takes him deeper, away from the main flows. He knows this underground city like his own bloodstream. He is heading somewhere.

scenes.location: Lower level maintenance corridor — rarely used

shots.action: A maintenance corridor deep in the underground. Pipes and cables line the walls. The lighting dim and warm compared to the main corridors. Anaya walks carefully, checking behind her. She is heading somewhere she should not be.

Anaya's point of view moving through the maintenance corridor. Dim warm light. Old pipes dripping. The scrap of paper in her hand, a number matching a junction marker on the wall. She is following Deep's directions. Around each corner could be a guard or an answer.

Anaya rounds a corner and stops. Deep is there, sitting on a pipe, notebook open, sketching by the light of a small bioluminescent cluster he has cultivated in the wall. He looks up. No surprise on his face — he expected someone to come. He has been drawing a door that does not exist yet.
shots.emotion: meeting of equals, beginning of everything

shots.action: Deep's face in the warm bioluminescent light. He looks at Anaya with an expression that is not surprise but recognition. As if he has been waiting not for anyone, but for her specifically. He removes his glasses and speaks. The first real words between them.

Close-up on Deep's hand holding the notebook, the drawing of a door visible. His fingers ink-stained, the lines precise. Cut to Anaya's eyes studying the drawing. Cut back to his hand pointing to a specific detail. Their breathing quiet. Trust forming in silence.

Deep spreads a larger drawing from his notebook. A structural map of the underground city. He points to where they are. Then traces upward. Layer by layer. Tunnel by tunnel. To a place marked with a single circle. Anaya follows his finger. Her breath catches.
shots.emotion: the plan revealed, vertigo of possibility

shots.action: Anaya's face as she understands what Deep is showing her. Not just a map. Not just a door. A way out. A way up. To the surface. To the sky she has only seen in glitches and fragments. Tears form but do not fall. She will not cry. She will act.

A sound echoes from the corridor. Both freeze. Anaya and Deep look at each other in the sudden silence. Their implants both flicker briefly in the same rhythm. A connection neither expected. The sound fades. Just settling pipes. They exhale together.

Anaya and Deep face each other in the dim corridor. Neither speaks yet. The bioluminescent light between them pulses gently. Deep slowly turns his notebook toward her — showing the drawing of a door. Anaya looks at it, then at him. A barely perceptible nod. The camera slowly pulls back as they begin to talk, voices too quiet to hear, two small figures in the vast underground.
shots.camera: slow zoom out to wide, then fade to black
shots.emotion: hope, conspiracy, the seed of revolution

scenes.mood: changed perspective, new eyes on old world

shots.action: Anaya walks back through the main corridors. Same corridors as before but she sees them differently now. The metal walls, the strip lights, the surveillance cameras she now notices for the first time. She walks with the same pace as other workers but her eyes are scanning, measuring, planning.
shots.emotion: seeing the cage for the first time

shots.action: Anaya's hand at her side. Hidden against her leg, she holds a torn page from Deep's notebook. A diagram with the word UP written at the top. Her fingers curl protectively around it. This paper is more dangerous than any weapon in the Mole World.

Deep in the data center, Lin works alone after hours. Their screen shows anomaly patterns they have been tracking. Three implant irregularities in the same cycle. Three cracks in the system. Lin saves the data to the hidden chip. They do not know Anaya and Deep yet. But the data knows.

Deep in his pod, staring at his hands in the dim light. Ink stains on his fingers. He flexes them slowly. These hands that draw tunnels and doors. He reaches into his coat and touches the notebook. Then he closes his eyes. Not sleeping. Planning.

Anaya in her pod. She unfolds the diagram Deep gave her. Studies it in the faint bioluminescent light. Her finger traces the path upward. Layer by layer. The distance is enormous. The risk is absolute. She folds it carefully and tucks it against her chest.

Anaya's implant behind her ear in the dim light. It pulses weakly. Blue. A flicker of red. Blue again. The crack in the system is small but it is real. Under the skin, the circuitry that was meant to keep her blind is failing. And she is not afraid anymore.

scenes.mood: vast, quiet, three lights flickering differently

shots.action: The underground city at night cycle. Seen from the highest point. The bioluminescent moss glows like a galaxy overhead. The city below is mostly dark, pods glowing faint blue. Thousands of identical lights. But three of them pulse differently. Barely noticeable. Three lives waking up.
shots.camera: extreme wide shot from above, slow drift

shots.action: Empty corridor at night. The strip lights are dimmed to red. No workers, no guards, just the hum of the ventilation system. The underground city breathing in its sleep. But somewhere in the walls, a new energy. A new frequency. Something the system cannot hear yet.

The entire cavern from the widest possible angle. The synthetic sky of bioluminescent moss above. The mechanical city below. Between them, the dark air of the underground. And somewhere in that darkness, invisible and unstoppable, the idea of a door. The idea of up. The idea of sky. Slow fade to black.
shots.emotion: the seed planted, chapter ending, revolution whispered

parts.title: The Mole World
